page.title: 08Bidston Today.
page.content: The village is now a strange island of antiquity in a sea of prefabrication.The layout of the village remains very much unaltered, though its importance to the community has dwindled.The farms have either lost their lands or are used as riding stables.The old school has been replaced by more modern buildings. The pubs and corner shops have closed,to be replaced by a larger,more functional set of buildings. {Bidston}is surrounded by a large, recent housing estate ({The Ford}),an equally large housing estate built in the 1930's,{Bidston Hill}which is a significant{Wirral}landmark and a vast expanse of open wetland known as{ {Bidston Moss}.
